snippet: Two corruption cases last week underscored a season of challenge for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, just as he is preparing to run for re-election next year.
abstract: Two corruption cases underscore season of challenge for Gov Andrew M Cuomo, who has faced more criticism over last few months than during much of his first two years; as he prepares for re-election bid in 2014, some of the governor's traditional allies are turning on him, his poll numbers have begun to show signs of erosion and the State Legislature has become more assertive.

byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Two corruption cases last week underscored a season of challenge for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, just as he is preparing to run for re-election next year.

headline.seo: After Long Honeymoon, Criticism of Cuomo Begins to Mount
headline.main: Criticism of Cuomo Grows as the Problems in Albany Endure
headline.print_headline: Criticism of Cuomo Grows as the Problems in Albany Endure
